bradfordr 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Use the Standardized Bradford Distribution in R with `bradfordr`

rbradford

Source: R/rbradford.R
rbradford.Rd

This function generates a vector of values from the Standardized Bradford Distribution with length n and parameter c.

rbradford(n, c = 5)

Arguments

n

number of observations. If length(n)>1, the length is taken to be the number required.
c

parameter of the standardized bradford distribution. Must be greater than 0.

Value

a vector of length n with values generated from the Standardized Bradford Distribution with parameter c.

Examples

rbradford(n=100, c=10)

#>   [1] 0.021364760 0.639381061 0.322306720 0.045785967 0.001790143 0.205984041
